title: Snow White
summary:
"Snow White" is a 19th-century German fairy tale that is today known widely across the Western world. The Brothers Grimm published it in 1812 in the first edition of their collection Grimms' Fairy Tales and numbered as Tale 53. The original German title was Sneewittchen, a Low German form, but the first version gave the High German translation Schneewei√üchen, and the tale has become known in German by the mixed form Schneewittchen. 
The Grimms completed their final revision of the story in 1854.[1][2]
